page.title: 08Housing
page.content: Woodcote has developed from a small scattered community into a large commuter dormitory village of 3000 people. In the last 20 years many new housing estates have been built. Most of the houses are made of brick and are detached or semi-detached. Over 90% of the houses in the village are owner occupied. Very few houses are more than 100 years old. Some of these older houses date from the Middle Ages. There are some thatched cottages which date from the 16th century. Outside the village are scattered farm houses, cottages and one or two large houses. There is a small settlement around an old coaching inn in Exlade Street which used to be part of the main road between Crowmarsh Gifford and Reading.
